intro: Eriophyllum staechadifolium var. artemisiifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved eriophyllum, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal scrub and open woodlands. This variety is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to other forms of Eriophyllum staechadifolium.
